text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to note that the court can refuse to act if it does not consider it appropriate to do so because the seat of arbitration is outside England & Wales. While the response discusses the court's discretion and the Singapore seat (mentioning that the court will ask 'Why not ask the Singapore tribunal first?' and that the court will scrutinize necessity), it does not explicitly state the legal principle that the court *can refuse* to act specifically because the seat is outside England & Wales, as mandated by the criterion.
